description.narrative:
The Overall Goal of the intervention is that Bosnia and Herzegovina translates Agenda 2030 into action for the benefit of all its citizens. The Project Outcome is as follows: Public and private sector partners prepared for implementation of the SDGs in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The project aims to capacitate and prepare private and public sector partners in Bosnia and Herzegovina for the SDGs implementation, thus directly supporting Bosnia and Herzegovina´s efforts to contribute to the largest global agenda that exists today Agenda 2030. The project envisages two outputs as follows: 1. SDG Roadmap for Bosnia and Herzegovina developed, and implementation started. 2. Private sector actors sensitized and engaged in SDGs prioritization, planning and implementation.

Projektet avser att hjälpa Bosnien och Hercegovina att definiera och implementera SDG-målen / 2030-Agendan till handling genom att samla relevanta partner kring SDG ”Roadmap” - en agenda med en tydlig vision för landet.
Projektet har för syfte att bygga kapacitet och förbereda privata och offentliga partners i Bosnien och Hercegovina för genomförandet av SDGs, med två följande effektmål: 1. SDGs ”Roadmap” för BiH utvecklas och att genomförandet påbörjades. 2. att privat sektor aktörer är sensibiliserad och engagerad i SDGs prioritering, planering och genomförande.

The project aims to capacitate and prepare private and public sector partners in Bosnia and Herzegovina for the SDGs implementation, thus directly supporting Bosnia and Herzegovina’s efforts to contribute to the largest global agenda that exists today – Agenda 2030.

tag.narrative: 17.14 - Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
17.14 - Föra en mer samstämmig politik för hållbar utveckling.

17.16 - Enhance the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development, complemented by multi-stakeholder partnerships that mobilize and share knowledge, expertise, technology and financial resources, to support the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals in all countries, in particular developing countries

description.narrative:
During the course of last year, formal adoption of the documents "Framework for Sustainable Development Goals in BiH" was adopted by the BIH Council of Ministers. The document was previously approved by the governments of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina (FBIH) , Republika Srpska (RS) and Brcko District (BD) receiving wide acceptance and support by all relevant stakeholders.
The formal adoption of the document represents fulfilment of objective 1 of the project (SDG Roadmap for Bosnia and Herzegovina developed, and implementation started). Adopted document serves as a main long-term development platform in the country. This is particularly important since the country's last development strategy was adopted in 2006. The document focuses on (i) Good governance and Public Sector management, (ii) Smart Growth, (iii) Society of Equal Opportunities linked through horizontal themes: Human Capital for the Future and the "Leave no one behind" principle. More importantly, it also includes measurable targets that all governments should aim to achieve by 2030. To that end, governments at all levels already initiated implementation of the SDG Framework by including development actions defined in their respective governmental strategies.
Furthermore, the BIH Council of Ministers in April of 2021 formally established SDG Council. The SDG Council serving as an inter-governmental body will be responsible to coordinate, monitor and report on behalf of the country.
When it comes second objective quantified through results, during the previous year the project continued to engage private sector actors through flagship activities established within the framework of the project i.e. SDG Business Accelerator and SME Decarbonisation Challenge. The continued increase in interest from the private sector also be measured through increased number of applications from private sector to two editions of the SDG Business Pioneers award held during the reporting period.
In reviewing the indicators set for the Component relevant for objective 2 of the project as indicated above, they are all achieved and over the initially set target. More specifically, relevant for this reporting period: 125 businesses were engaged in consultation on SDGs out of 605 in total (initial target 500), 145 SDG business pioneers were promoted during the reporting period out of 187 while in 2020 71 businesses were promoted.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
